content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task to scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement them as PopeBot skills. Let me break this down:

1. First, I need to scan the three GitHub repositories to find ideas
2. For each good idea, create:
   - SKILL.md with frontmatter describing capabilities
   - Implementation code 
   - Write and run a test to prove it works
3. After building everything, email a comprehensive report

Let me start by fetching these repositories to see what's available. I'll use the web-fetch skill to scan them.

content.text: I'll systematically scan all three GitHub repositories for new ideas and implement them as PopeBot skills. Let me start by fetching information from each repository.
EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read

content.thinking: Let me list the directory contents instead using bash.
